title.narrative: Environmental and Safety Protection Agency in Cartagena or Barranquilla 2

description.narrative: Cartagena and Barranquilla are one of the biggest cities in Colombia with busy and expanding industrial ports. This creates challenges for the safety and environmental situation. The municipality of Cartagena and other stakeholders, such as the fire department and representatives of companies have indicated that they would like to learn from best practices in the Netherlands in this field.The initiative of this project has come about through the good work of the Dutch THSA (The Holland Safety & Security Association). They have persuaded the local authorities of both Barranquilla and Cartagena that their preparedness for an (industrial) calamity is wholly inadequate, with dire consequences for both the civilian population and future economic prospects, were such a calamity to occur.Setting up a local authority for the granting of EIA (Environmental Impact Assessment) operation licenses, as well as to conduct inspections in order to enforce compliance could be the key to an improved environmental/safety performance with clear and enforceable permits, as well as a credible, transparent inspection regime.As a follow-up of the project TF15COP26A, DOTES (Dutch Operational Training Equipment Services) has been commissioned by the Netherlands Enterprise Agency for the following activities regarding the preparations for the set up of an Environmental and Safety Protection Agency in Barranquilla or Cartagena:1. To arrange a visit to Cartagena or Barranquilla.2. To maintain contacts with involved Colombian ministries/local governmental parties.3. To define a joint programme.4. To provide a report about the conducted activities.
